title: Gaps
content:
The indicator allows you to determine price gaps between neighboring bars.

To add and set up the indicator, open the Indicators settings window.


Indicator's settings

Settings

NameDescription
Close partially Determines whether to use partial gap closure.
Minimal deviation Defines the minimum acceptable deviation from the average candle size to determine a valid gap size.
Limit max gap body length Determines whether to limit the maximum length of the specified element.
Max gap body length Defines the maximum allowed length of the specified element.

Visualization

NameDescription
Hide gaps Determines whether to hide the display of gaps on the chart.
Bullish color Sets the color for elements with a bullish direction.
Bearish color Sets the color for elements with a bearish direction.
Hide border Determines whether to hide the display of the specified element's borders.
Border width Sets the width of the border of the displayed element (in pixels).
Transparency This setting allows users to customize transparency of the visual objects on the chart.

Label

NameDescription
Show Determines whether the text label should be displayed.
Size Determines the size of the text to be displayed.
Color Sets the color of the label text.
OffsetX Sets the x-axis offset of the label in pixels.
Offset Y Sets the y-axis offset of the label in pixels.

Alerts

NameDescription
Use alerts Enables or disables the sound notification.
Alert File This parameter allows users to specify the name of a custom audio file for alert sounds. Users can select a WAV file that will be played whenever an alert condition is triggered. The chosen WAV file should be located in the folder C:\Program Files (x86)\ATAS Platform\Sounds.
Font Color Sets the color of the text in the alert window.
Background Sets the background color of the alert window.
